name: fish canning plant construction and maintenance | fish canning plant | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/18449/documentation

The activity represents the construction and maintenance along its lifetime of a fish canning (including fish pre-processing) plant, expressed as the installed capacity required to process 1000 kg of raw material. The life cycle inventories were produced based on a sample of 1 Peruvian plant (processing capacity: 461 t/y), 1 Ecuadorian plant (61 000 t/y) and data from other industry representatives. This dataset may be adapted to other global production sites.;System boundaries of fish processing plants and relations between activities

From construction of the plant, through maintenance.

End of life treatment of the plant
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/429:Construction of other civil engineering projects/4290:Construction of other civil engineering projects

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Production figures represent the period 2012-2014. Valid as of 2017.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Representative of Peru and Ecuador. In Peru, as of 2017 there were 71 active fish canning plants, with an aggregated processing capacity of 545 000 t/y. In Ecuador, as of 2014 there were 27 active tuna canning plants, with an aggregated processing capacity of 671 400 t/y.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Construction and maintenance activities of Peruvian and Ecuadorian fish canning plants, per t of processing capacity. Plants have a lifespan of 40 years.;Process diagram of large fish canning;Process diagram of small fish canning
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data from two different sized-plants were extrapolated on the basis of built area and processing capacity, to represent any plant of the same type, regardless of size.

exchanges.description: One unit of plant represents the installed capacity required to process 1 t of raw material, including annual maintenance of the infrastructure, over the plant's lifetime.
